wait_for is the last script still used by tripleo-ci from

commit_message:
Add wait_for from tripleo-incubator

wait_for is the last script still used by tripleo-ci from
tripleo-incubator.  This commit brings the script over into tripleo-ci
(like we did in the past for other scripts) so that we can continue with
removing tripleo-incubator.

Change-Id: Icd62f75df3e27ead780a392b34a9720b127c9b6d

Cinder has transitioned to using versioned objects,
the Windows SMB driver should reflect this as well.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-07 23:35:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'doc/source/man/nova-manage.rst', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': 'Add an update_cell command to nova-manage

In case a cell record was incorrectly created, or needs to be updated
to point to a new database or mq endpoint, we need a way for users to
be able to update a CellMapping record. Since deleting and re-creating
is definitely not an option, this patch adds an update_cell which
allows updating the mutable fields if necessary.

Change-Id: I75ddfa458a6fb650f1098505193398984f2be596
'}]
commit_message:
Add an update_cell command to nova-manage

In case a cell record was incorrectly created, or needs to be updated
to point to a new database or mq endpoint, we need a way for users to
be able to update a CellMapping record. Since deleting and re-creating
is definitely not an option, this patch adds an update_cell which
allows updating the mutable fields if necessary.

Change-Id: I75ddfa458a6fb650f1098505193398984f2be596

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8997, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'username': 'whayutin', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21686, 'name': 'Matt Young', 'email': 'halcyondude@gmail.com', 'username': 'myoung'}, {'_account_id': 24752, 'name': 'RedHat RDO Downstream CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins+downstream@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci-downstream', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-30 14:44:44.000000000', 'files': ['roles/validate-ha/vars/test_list_mitaka.yml', 'roles/validate-ha/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/validate-ha/vars/test_list_ocata.yml', 'roles/validate-ha/vars/test_list_master.yml', 'roles/validate-ha/vars/test_list_newton.yml', 'roles/validate-ha/README.md'], 'message': 'Make validation HA tests atomic

This commit defines a var file for each release containing the list of
the HA validation tests that should be done. These new variables are now
also used as booleans to determine if a test should be executed or not.
With this new approach a user will be able to exclude (or include) tests
at runtime, like this:

./quickstart.sh \
  --retain-inventory \
  ...
  ...
  --release mitaka \
  --tags "overcloud-validate-ha" \
  --extra-vars test_ha_failed_actions=false \
  --extra-vars test_ha_master_slave=false \
  --extra-vars test_ha_keystone_constraint_removal=false \
  --extra-vars test_ha_instance=true \
  $VIRTHOST

In this case I will test just the instance deployment.
This means that without any extra var tests will be the default
depending on the release, otherwise specific tests will be made.
It also updates the README with all these new informations.

Change-Id: I113b8e929dddb9ff18b57faa905a754e2f6b5999
'}]
commit_message:
Make validation HA tests atomic

This commit defines a var file for each release containing the list of
the HA validation tests that should be done. These new variables are now
also used as booleans to determine if a test should be executed or not.
With this new approach a user will be able to exclude (or include) tests
at runtime, like this:

./quickstart.sh \
  --retain-inventory \
  ...
  ...
  --release mitaka \
  --tags "overcloud-validate-ha" \
  --extra-vars test_ha_failed_actions=false \
  --extra-vars test_ha_master_slave=false \
  --extra-vars test_ha_keystone_constraint_removal=false \
  --extra-vars test_ha_instance=true \
  $VIRTHOST

In this case I will test just the instance deployment.
This means that without any extra var tests will be the default
depending on the release, otherwise specific tests will be made.
It also updates the README with all these new informations.

Change-Id: I113b8e929dddb9ff18b57faa905a754e2f6b5999

subject: Trivial: remove support for py34
revisions:

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to

Change-Id: I6285c437afecf838ec1357633369b01d31599e5c

commit_message:
Trivial: remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I6285c437afecf838ec1357633369b01d31599e5c

commit_message:
Trivial: remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: If834ba9f791cdcc87d06edc089d9457f0bf2286c

commit_message:
Cleanup unused/deprecated files

Remove / change some places that are long deprecated or no longer
needed:

- openstack-common.conf - was used for pulling code from oslo-incubator,
  but that is dead for at least 8 months already.

- deploy.yaml playbook - declared as deprecated more than a year ago

- enroll.yaml playbook - declared as deprecated more than a year ago

- a task and var in bifrost-test-vm role - deprecated test

commit_message:
Fix alarm count failing with metric name

Created a tempest test that showed that alarm-count with metric-name failed
with a 500.

Fixed the sqla implementation of get_alarms_count(). Not sure how it
happened, but the code for querying by metric-name was all wrong.
Replaced bad code with code from get_alarms() for handling the metric-name.

Also, add test for count alarms by state and refactor some tests to remove
duplicate code

Change-Id: I7ecb896fd6594fa11c5f2029bec44f09ef413637

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 8158, 'name': 'Hemanth Makkapati', 'email': 'makstacker+osgerrit@gmail.com', 'username': 'hemanth.makkapati'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}, {'_account_id': 19587, 'name': 'Joshua White', 'email': 'joshua.l.white@intel.com', 'username': 'jwhite'}, {'_account_id': 21722, 'name': 'Dharini Chandrasekar', 'email': 'dharini.chandrasekar@intel.com', 'username': 'dharinic'}, {'_account_id': 22448, 'name': 'Alexander Bashmakov', 'email': 'abashmak@yahoo.com', 'username': 'abashmak'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-27 19:50:49.000000000', 'files': ['glance/registry/api/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v1/test_registry_api.py'], 'message': 'Stricter checks for registry API calls

When v1 images API is enabled and v2 disabled, v2 registry gets
invoked if the registry opts are left with the defaults. i.e.,
v1_api makes a call to v2_registry. This is an API mismatch and
is not preferred.

NOTE:
v1 image api and v2 image api can be configured individually.
This patch performs stricter checks to ensure correct registry
API calls as follows:
* If enable_v1_api is set to True, enable_v1_registry
  MUST be set to True.
  So make a call to v1 registry only if both enable_v1_api
  and enable_v1_registry are set to True.
* enable_v2_registry need not be set to True even if
  enable_v2_api is set to True.
  So only if enable_v2_registry and enable_v2_api are set
  to True we make a call to v2_registry. This is required as
  a be-sure mechanism to prevent a call to v2_registry when
  ONLY v1_api is enabled. (See bug report)

Change-Id: I07a1d02070a0f041d5076ec1fefa783ce875c1d8
Closes-Bug: 1516706
'}]
commit_message:
Stricter checks for registry API calls

When v1 images API is enabled and v2 disabled, v2 registry gets
invoked if the registry opts are left with the defaults. i.e.,
v1_api makes a call to v2_registry. This is an API mismatch and
is not preferred.

NOTE:
v1 image api and v2 image api can be configured individually.
This patch performs stricter checks to ensure correct registry
API calls as follows:
* If enable_v1_api is set to True, enable_v1_registry
  MUST be set to True.
  So make a call to v1 registry only if both enable_v1_api
  and enable_v1_registry are set to True.
* enable_v2_registry need not be set to True even if
  enable_v2_api is set to True.
  So only if enable_v2_registry and enable_v2_api are set
  to True we make a call to v2_registry. This is required as
  a be-sure mechanism to prevent a call to v2_registry when
  ONLY v1_api is enabled. (See bug report)

Change-Id: I07a1d02070a0f041d5076ec1fefa783ce875c1d8
Closes-Bug: 1516706

commit_message:
Implementing stricter permissions on config files

The security guide suggests that all OpenStack service config files
should be owned by root and in the service user group with 0640 permissions.

Change-Id: I60f8aa7cfb61b15be847fb3d380b0926fb1009dd
(cherry picked from commit 8117a8224560d9d1ee9a168bf069a5d3373a5547)

subject: Use RDO/UCA everywhere
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 15:36:43.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/pre_install.yml', 'vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Use RDO/UCA everywhere

The pip_install role installs binary dependencies, like python-openssl
(on Ubuntu), or pyOpenSSL (on Centos).

By default, we didn't configure extra sources (like UCA or RDO)
in the pip_install role. Because the repo is built using UCA or RDO
(current default), we could have inconsistency issues:
containers that haven't UCA or RDO applied during their role execution
would run with a venv packaged for a different python-openssl
(or python-cryptography).

This commit brings the consistency by installing UCA/RDO everywhere.

Closes-Bug: 1624791

Change-Id: I9b5cd40b2972c93af348d4ddfde21a038cf9becc
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(cherry picked from commit fe4fa1882229c22478357c82a71a4227d868b8c5)
"}]
commit_message:
Use RDO/UCA everywhere

The pip_install role installs binary dependencies, like python-openssl
(on Ubuntu), or pyOpenSSL (on Centos).

By default, we didn't configure extra sources (like UCA or RDO)
in the pip_install role. Because the repo is built using UCA or RDO
(current default), we could have inconsistency issues:
containers that haven't UCA or RDO applied during their role execution
would run with a venv packaged for a different python-openssl
(or python-cryptography).

This commit brings the consistency by installing UCA/RDO everywhere.

Closes-Bug: 1624791

Change-Id: I9b5cd40b2972c93af348d4ddfde21a038cf9becc
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(cherry picked from commit fe4fa1882229c22478357c82a71a4227d868b8c5)

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: Ib5f86d1f0846e292457813c893b73c6999e554a5
Closes-Bug: #1596829

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 15:46:53.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'library/keystone_sp', 'tasks/keystone_federation_sp_setup.yml'], 'message': 'Resolved Keystone Federation bugs

The keystone role needed a few updates to deal with modern Ansible.

  * The changeset pulls in the needed updates to resolve issues causing
    the keystone_sp plugin, which powers federation, to crash.
  * The changeset pulls in style changes for keystone cert sync removing
    the need for the role to leverage the now deprecated memcached key
    module.

Closes-Bug: 1660626

Change-Id: I29d444c9631a7511123aa6cd521a20a0e7588645
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit a6ee6100c5c1dfc3c0657af19652e30d5bbdde74)

commit_message:
Resolved Keystone Federation bugs

The keystone role needed a few updates to deal with modern Ansible.

  * The changeset pulls in the needed updates to resolve issues causing
    the keystone_sp plugin, which powers federation, to crash.
  * The changeset pulls in style changes for keystone cert sync removing
    the need for the role to leverage the now deprecated memcached key
    module.

Closes-Bug: 1660626

Change-Id: I29d444c9631a7511123aa6cd521a20a0e7588645
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit a6ee6100c5c1dfc3c0657af19652e30d5bbdde74)

subject: Fix idempotence for nova cell1 create
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-09 15:43:12.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_db_setup.yml'], 'message': "Fix idempotence for nova cell1 create

nova-manage returns 0 if the cell is created, 1 if the cell creation
fails, and 2 if the cell already exists. So we can use the return
codes from nova-manage to avoid failure when the cell already exists,
and also to properly set ansible's ok/changed status.

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1102441a4259fe155eb2a61cd16c6e015787472c/nova/cmd/manage.py#L1425

Change-Id: I078caf682aa01db6d5a1472946b25159f3473586
"}]
commit_message:
Fix idempotence for nova cell1 create

nova-manage returns 0 if the cell is created, 1 if the cell creation
fails, and 2 if the cell already exists. So we can use the return
codes from nova-manage to avoid failure when the cell already exists,
and also to properly set ansible's ok/changed status.

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1102441a4259fe155eb2a61cd16c6e015787472c/nova/cmd/manage.py#L1425

Change-Id: I078caf682aa01db6d5a1472946b25159f3473586

subject: Wait for nova-compute service registration
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-02-09 16:07:17.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/nova_compute_wait.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Wait for nova-compute service registration

A race condition is caused when nova-compute is started for the
first time because it takes a period of time for nova-compute
to spin up, register itself with nova API, and become available for
cell enrollment.

Prior to this there was no wait condition when nova-compute
restarts occurred, so the first time nova-compute started, often
the compute service was not registered in the database and available
for cell enrollment when the enrollment tasks ran.

Change-Id: I510f0a957f53d15affa1fc23f809abff52208438
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for nova-compute service registration

A race condition is caused when nova-compute is started for the
first time because it takes a period of time for nova-compute
to spin up, register itself with nova API, and become available for
cell enrollment.

Prior to this there was no wait condition when nova-compute
restarts occurred, so the first time nova-compute started, often
the compute service was not registered in the database and available
for cell enrollment when the enrollment tasks ran.

Change-Id: I510f0a957f53d15affa1fc23f809abff52208438

from COPR rather than installing from source. This saves time and

commit_message:
Use COPR pkg for LXC on CentOS

This patch adjusts the CentOS installation process to use a package
from COPR rather than installing from source. This saves time and
avoids issues from compiling LXC from source.

The source installation tasks have been removed.

Change-Id: Iba42de56b8c548d0defa61fad72d8211a08df9bc
(cherry picked from commit d8e4fd33093951290db374378e537462a83b4c33)

commit_message:
tests: split two kind of functional tests

We have two kinds of functional tests. Those run with
the wsgi_intercepter and those run on a real Gnocchi server.

We currently the wsgi_intercepter tests in two jobs, the classic tox
pyXX and the functional one.

This change rearrange tests to makje clear the purpose of each tests
and to not run them twice in gate.

Change-Id: Ie0339ed92b790bebb0f4a5ed0dc5b690fa8ce4fa

commit_message:
Enable Keystone v3 support for nova_flavor and nova_aggregate

Both providers were previously using Credentialsv2_0, which do not
work in a Keystone v3 environment (and that's what we should be
using today).

Change-Id: Ib1509b8b5422a8749d7f7689b77dc4abab50dbf7
(cherry picked from commit 343bf012c1a4c34c69fb6d36906a2d2c33956a5d)

subject: Change endpoint-test -1 to 1 return code
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-09 04:43:56.000000000', 'files': ['tests/bin/endpoint_test.sh'], 'message': 'Change endpoint-test -1 to 1 return code

POSIX and bash in general prefer 0> error codes.  The -1 error
codes are casted to an unsigned value creating some misery in
decoding return codes.

Change-Id: I5b3b8f95d385c62c774da662bb52d7951b69b9a7
'}]
commit_message:
Change endpoint-test -1 to 1 return code

POSIX and bash in general prefer 0> error codes.  The -1 error
codes are casted to an unsigned value creating some misery in
decoding return codes.

Change-Id: I5b3b8f95d385c62c774da662bb52d7951b69b9a7

Document the magic in endpoint_test.sh

isn't set.  If it is set return the return code from the various cp
operations.

commit_message:
Fix number of issues with grenade job

- Use domain ids along with domain names

It's possible that either the domain_id or domain_name
is set in the env.

- Adds an workaround for bug #1662911

- Fix shutdown script for apache

Change-Id: Ib9d3c14327d73d8cb0e0cddcc9d16191797ffffa
Closes-Bug: #1663105

subject: Temporarily bypass tests for Ubuntu Trusty
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 15:17:14.000000000', 'files': ['test-ansible-functional.sh'], 'message': "Temporarily bypass tests for Ubuntu Trusty

Ubuntu Trusty is not a supported platform for Ocata onwards.
Currently the CI system is executing jobs against Trusty
unintentionally and it's taking some time to unwind it.

This bypasses all tests if the platform detected is Trusty
so that development can continue while we work out the CI
configuration issue.

Change-Id: I236cf4aa748c22ad0249c1eb62e7fc64736f7f7f
(cherry picked from commit 7698aebf69592807cede7735b9408fe02507b962)
"}]
commit_message:
Temporarily bypass tests for Ubuntu Trusty

Ubuntu Trusty is not a supported platform for Ocata onwards.
Currently the CI system is executing jobs against Trusty
unintentionally and it's taking some time to unwind it.

This bypasses all tests if the platform detected is Trusty
so that development can continue while we work out the CI
configuration issue.

Change-Id: I236cf4aa748c22ad0249c1eb62e7fc64736f7f7f
(cherry picked from commit 7698aebf69592807cede7735b9408fe02507b962)

subject: Fixed man_pages no value warning when making docs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 21:56:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Fixed man_pages no value warning when making docs

When building keystonemiddleware docs, the following warning
is currently emitted:

WARNING: no "man_pages" config value found;
no manual pages will be written

This change comments out man_pages since it was only
specifying an empty list, and the warning no longer appears.

Change-Id: Ia650abc6cb3b3bcf36469cae9d8c20e83d0317a4
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed man_pages no value warning when making docs

When building keystonemiddleware docs, the following warning
is currently emitted:

WARNING: no "man_pages" config value found;
no manual pages will be written

This change comments out man_pages since it was only
specifying an empty list, and the warning no longer appears.

Change-Id: Ia650abc6cb3b3bcf36469cae9d8c20e83d0317a4

commit_message:
Add note about device_owner value in neutron ports

Neutron ports associated with instances must start with
the prefix 'compute:', else the agents will not process
them properly.

Change-Id: I82c5f9e4d122a064c23843a5a7693e49fa0378c9
Closes-bug: #1644231

commit_message:
Implementing stricter permissions on config files

The security guide suggests that all OpenStack service config files
should be owned by root and in the service user group with 0640 permissions.

http://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/block-storage/checklist.html#check-block-01-is-user-group-ownership-of-config-files-set-to-root-cinder

Change-Id: Ic175909c24bbc1f5a7d8e521d880e1a63afa887b
(cherry picked from commit e9cf96f4472177b23ce0dce43f7fe87927828776)

commit_message:
Deprecate the AdminTokenAuthMiddleware

Now that we have real support for bootstrapping keystone there is no
need to keep this around. In addition to the deprecation I've removed it
from the default pipelines.

bp deprecated-as-of-ocata

Change-Id: I6deb66eb1450d76ac246a91f8cf9e1e3a417e39e

commit_message:
Move fluentd td.repo to base for consistency

Additional repos for centos such as elasticsearch, ceph etc. are all set
up in the base image, fluentd should follow this both for consistency
and to make it easier for operators to remove/override.

Change-Id: If2ee20232d72ccf6b1c4be06c2fb3d1fa219e9cc

commit_message:
Switch main components to transport_url

Messaging rabbit-* parameters are deprecated in upstream, so
this patch switches all main components to usage of transport_url

Change-Id: I042f68ac1aeb14234898711a25eaebe0836cbb90
Partial-Bug: #1477967
(cherry picked from commit 3d7f2ab803767c6ce7734d3297d6206387b50217)

commit_message:
Implementing stricter permissions on config files

The security guide suggests that /etc/horizon/local-settings.py
should be owned by root and in the horizon group with 0640 permissions.

Change-Id: I4a49394cd2afb92e0da1b233e21bad862ddee059

commit_message:
Implementing stricter permissions on config files

The security guide suggests that all OpenStack service config files
should be owned by root and in the service user group with 0640 permissions.

Change-Id: I60f8aa7cfb61b15be847fb3d380b0926fb1009dd
(cherry picked from commit 8117a8224560d9d1ee9a168bf069a5d3373a5547)

subject: Use RDO/UCA everywhere
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-07 13:36:50.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/pre_install.yml', 'vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Use RDO/UCA everywhere

The pip_install role installs binary dependencies, like python-openssl
(on Ubuntu), or pyOpenSSL (on Centos).

By default, we didn't configure extra sources (like UCA or RDO)
in the pip_install role. Because the repo is built using UCA or RDO
(current default), we could have inconsistency issues:
containers that haven't UCA or RDO applied during their role execution
would run with a venv packaged for a different python-openssl
(or python-cryptography).

This commit brings the consistency by installing UCA/RDO everywhere.

Closes-Bug: 1624791

Change-Id: I9b5cd40b2972c93af348d4ddfde21a038cf9becc
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
"}]
commit_message:
Use RDO/UCA everywhere

The pip_install role installs binary dependencies, like python-openssl
(on Ubuntu), or pyOpenSSL (on Centos).

By default, we didn't configure extra sources (like UCA or RDO)
in the pip_install role. Because the repo is built using UCA or RDO
(current default), we could have inconsistency issues:
containers that haven't UCA or RDO applied during their role execution
would run with a venv packaged for a different python-openssl
(or python-cryptography).

This commit brings the consistency by installing UCA/RDO everywhere.

Closes-Bug: 1624791

Change-Id: I9b5cd40b2972c93af348d4ddfde21a038cf9becc
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>

subject: Transition half of test_floating_ip_neutron to requests_mock
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-06 23:01:55.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_neutron.py', 'shade/tests/fakes.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Transition half of test_floating_ip_neutron to requests_mock

There is too much going on here for a single patch, and my brain hurts
too.

We need to come back through and refactor test_auto_ip_pool_no_reuse.
The resources involved are all accurate (took them from a live
interaction with citycloud for verification purposes) but doing complex
tests that way is a pile of copy-pasta.

Also, found a logic error in the flow of having created a server and
then separately requested a FIP be attached to it with reuse=False. The
logic error is that the check to see if the server has a FIP already is
using a stale copy of the server dict which cannot possibly have a FIP
attached.

Change-Id: Ia38294cf48bcb46c18892605fd52da7dadaeefc8
'}]
commit_message:
Transition half of test_floating_ip_neutron to requests_mock

There is too much going on here for a single patch, and my brain hurts
too.

We need to come back through and refactor test_auto_ip_pool_no_reuse.
The resources involved are all accurate (took them from a live
interaction with citycloud for verification purposes) but doing complex
tests that way is a pile of copy-pasta.

Also, found a logic error in the flow of having created a server and
then separately requested a FIP be attached to it with reuse=False. The
logic error is that the check to see if the server has a FIP already is
using a stale copy of the server dict which cannot possibly have a FIP
attached.

Change-Id: Ia38294cf48bcb46c18892605fd52da7dadaeefc8

Ubuntu Trusty is not a supported platform for Ocata onwards.
Currently the CI system is executing jobs against Trusty
unintentionally and it's taking some time to unwind it.

Change-Id: I236cf4aa748c22ad0249c1eb62e7fc64736f7f7f
"}]
commit_message:
Temporarily bypass tests for Ubuntu Trusty

Ubuntu Trusty is not a supported platform for Ocata onwards.
Currently the CI system is executing jobs against Trusty
unintentionally and it's taking some time to unwind it.

This bypasses all tests if the platform detected is Trusty
so that development can continue while we work out the CI
configuration issue.

Change-Id: I236cf4aa748c22ad0249c1eb62e7fc64736f7f7f

commit_message:
Add nova-manage cell_v2 list_cells command

We have some commands which create cells and some commands
which take a cell uuid as an argument but don't have a way
to list cells, so this adds a command to do that.

Change-Id: I0f79e8c16c41ed45f9f59c20644511c7f130cdf9
Closes-Bug: #1656675

commit_message:
Pass task to post_task_run hook

It's hard for consumers to do anything useful in post_task_run without a
copy of the task. Also - not adding this as an optional becaues the
consumer this was written for, nodepool, has not started using it yet,
and I find it VERY hard to believe anyone else will have picked up on
this.

Change-Id: Ib48fe54feb8b6ed10da3e5fa9accf985e4b22623

subject: Work around Trusty CI bindep issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 14:08:56.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': "Work around Trusty CI bindep issue

Ubuntu Trusty is not a supported platform for Ocata onwards.
Currently the CI system is executing jobs against Trusty
unintentionally and it's taking some time to unwind it.

This bypasses the attempt to install a package that isn't
available for Trusty.

Change-Id: I544e71cee883245397b2a9012b2b56d83104ad4b
(cherry picked from commit 74acf48f2df7555a6fcb5c693c4a68a04ab42302)
"}]
commit_message:
Work around Trusty CI bindep issue

Ubuntu Trusty is not a supported platform for Ocata onwards.
Currently the CI system is executing jobs against Trusty
unintentionally and it's taking some time to unwind it.

This bypasses the attempt to install a package that isn't
available for Trusty.

Change-Id: I544e71cee883245397b2a9012b2b56d83104ad4b
(cherry picked from commit 74acf48f2df7555a6fcb5c693c4a68a04ab42302)

commit_message:
Work around Trusty CI bindep issue

Ubuntu Trusty is not a supported platform for Ocata onwards.
Currently the CI system is executing jobs against Trusty
unintentionally and it's taking some time to unwind it.

This bypasses the attempt to install a package that isn't
available for Trusty.

Change-Id: I343e357fa036222b056939d8db9cd8f7e8a45b7a
(cherry picked from commit 228158e91be8338b98c7cdf630eb40d2707d8141)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-03 17:05:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vif.py'], 'message': 'Fix VirtualInterfacePlugException message info

In vif.py plug method, the HttpError exception reason
will be specified to make VirtualInterfacePlugException

In SRIOV vif driver plug code, if no ethernet ports are
found on a physical network for an instance then instead
of vif details this change will furnish instance mac

Closes-bug: #1661609
'}]
commit_message:
Fix VirtualInterfacePlugException message info

In vif.py plug method, the HttpError exception reason
will be specified to make VirtualInterfacePlugException
raised more meaningful.

In SRIOV vif driver plug code, if no ethernet ports are
found on a physical network for an instance then instead
of vif details this change will furnish instance mac
address as more meaningful data to user.

Change-Id: Ia9072f45829018c51ba42e5cb032bff7d7eadd23
Closes-bug: #1661609

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 16:01:08.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/handlers/test_l3_rpc.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/common/l3_test_common.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/pd.py'], 'message': "Fix inconsistent router info for update

Prefix update to neutron server will cause the server to update the
corresponding subnet and any outstanding ports on the subnet. As a
result, router update will be sent to the l3 agents where the router
resides. It's found that router update would contain inconsistent
information if it were generated as part of update_subnet in
db_base_plugin_v2.py as indicated in the bug report (Refer to the logs
in the bug).

The fix is to move the router update call out of update_subnet. This
will make sure that the DB transactions as executed in update_subnet
are completed. Consequently, information retrieved from the db and
populated in the router update will be consistent.

Change-Id: I31cf4fcb1df4b0dc125d30050a3aba14d05dd7eb
Closes-Bug: #1639033
"}]
commit_message:
Fix inconsistent router info for update

Prefix update to neutron server will cause the server to update the
corresponding subnet and any outstanding ports on the subnet. As a
result, router update will be sent to the l3 agents where the router
resides. It's found that router update would contain inconsistent
information if it were generated as part of update_subnet in
db_base_plugin_v2.py as indicated in the bug report (Refer to the logs
in the bug).

The fix is to move the router update call out of update_subnet. This
will make sure that the DB transactions as executed in update_subnet
are completed. Consequently, information retrieved from the db and
populated in the router update will be consistent.

Change-Id: I31cf4fcb1df4b0dc125d30050a3aba14d05dd7eb
Closes-Bug: #1639033

subject: Target unbound component group instead of _all
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 12:04:33.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/unbound-install.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml'], 'message': 'Target unbound component group instead of _all

The unbound container group and component group share the same name,
so we are hitting the quirk in OSA inventory where containerized
services that have component and container groups sharing the same
name get both the hosts and containers added to the _all group.

This change targets the component group to correctly target only
the unbound containers, not the physical hosts for the containers.

Change-Id: Id214bbebeee73a6bf48088396e2e450669e00926
(cherry picked from commit 59b34958b7b69a90486fea33bd89c80997fa449c)
'}]
commit_message:
Target unbound component group instead of _all

The unbound container group and component group share the same name,
so we are hitting the quirk in OSA inventory where containerized
services that have component and container groups sharing the same
name get both the hosts and containers added to the _all group.

This change targets the component group to correctly target only
the unbound containers, not the physical hosts for the containers.

Change-Id: Id214bbebeee73a6bf48088396e2e450669e00926
(cherry picked from commit 59b34958b7b69a90486fea33bd89c80997fa449c)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-09 13:32:46.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/horizon_contexts.py', 'templates/newton/local_settings.py'], 'message': 'Re-enable plugins ability to send local_settings

In the past the plugin interface was renamed but the context was
not updated meaning that subordinates could no longer send plugin
data. This change fixes the relation name the context uses and
updates the Newton template to render these settings (earlier
templates already do this)

Closes-Bug: 1578824

Change-Id: I57e4e526019bc91bdf1df77c60da33ae108e0b49
'}]
commit_message:
Re-enable plugins ability to send local_settings

In the past the plugin interface was renamed but the context was
not updated meaning that subordinates could no longer send plugin
data. This change fixes the relation name the context uses and
updates the Newton template to render these settings (earlier
templates already do this)

Closes-Bug: 1578824

Change-Id: I57e4e526019bc91bdf1df77c60da33ae108e0b49

commit_message:
Disable midonet unit tests

'https://github.com/midonet/puppet-midonet' doesn't exist anymore, we
need to migrate to 'https://github.com/openstack/puppet-midonet' but
tests will fail.

We need to work with Midokura to get them fixed. In the meantime, let's
disable it.

Change-Id: Id39bc5a8cd229df3e9b597a0a0f3eada838f4953

commit_message:
Add offset & limit docs & tests

A number of endpoints enable pagination via 'limit' & 'offset' query
parameters, but don't document or test this functionality.

 - os-cells
 - os-security-groups
 - os-server-groups
 - os-snapshots
 - os-virtual-interfaces
 - os-volume-attachments
 - os-volumes

Change-Id: I5b0ad25f7282f4a13bbb6f21b76e986e1008936a

subject: Use explicit path in Xenial
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 09:51:36.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/fuel_bootstrap/files/xenial/usr/bin/fix-configs-on-startup', 'contrib/fuel_bootstrap/files/xenial/etc/rc.local'], 'message': 'Use explicit path in Xenial

Nobody promised PATH to be set during rc.local execution by systemd. And
it happens that this is the case on some systems, i.e. the PATH is not
set by the time of rc.local execution.

Change-Id: I4806df3217dd09430ad45b13cda49fab0925cb88
Partial-Bug: #1656150
(cherry picked from commit 5c612875a6881b1c93c4dac04759f9e806a3ee1d)
'}]
commit_message:
Use explicit path in Xenial

Nobody promised PATH to be set during rc.local execution by systemd. And
it happens that this is the case on some systems, i.e. the PATH is not
set by the time of rc.local execution.

Change-Id: I4806df3217dd09430ad45b13cda49fab0925cb88
Partial-Bug: #1656150
(cherry picked from commit 5c612875a6881b1c93c4dac04759f9e806a3ee1d)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 14:07:22.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': "Work around Trusty CI bindep issue

Ubuntu Trusty is not a supported platform for Ocata onwards.
Currently the CI system is executing jobs against Trusty
unintentionally and it's taking some time to unwind it.

This bypasses the attempt to install a package that isn't
available for Trusty.

commit_message:
Work around Trusty CI bindep issue

Ubuntu Trusty is not a supported platform for Ocata onwards.
Currently the CI system is executing jobs against Trusty
unintentionally and it's taking some time to unwind it.

This bypasses the attempt to install a package that isn't
available for Trusty.

Change-Id: I25f0cd4860c1d53dc364eacfd8f397660b6efe05
(cherry picked from commit d7141eec5261930ad4991307e1893e800e2ab75c)

subject: Add Tempest tests for invalid IDs and fix potential 500 errors
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-26 16:59:05.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_api/v2/reference/notificationstype.py', 'monasca_api/v2/reference/alarm_definitions.py', 'monasca_api/v2/reference/metrics.py', 'monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_alarms.py', 'monasca_api/v2/reference/notifications.py', 'monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_notification_methods.py', 'monasca_api/v2/reference/alarms.py', 'monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_alarm_definitions.py'], 'message': 'Add Tempest tests for invalid IDs and fix potential 500 errors

Add tests that an invalid ID returns 404 for update, patch and delete
methods for alarms, alarm definitions and notification methods.  Some
of these tests already existed but this ensures a complete set of
tests exists for these cases.

Move the resource try catch block wrapper to the correct layer
so that it catches all potential Internal Server Errors and throws
the proper exception.

Change-Id: I07159d0eaed995518bb0c0e2fbf446dff65ec632
'}]
commit_message:
Add Tempest tests for invalid IDs and fix potential 500 errors

Add tests that an invalid ID returns 404 for update, patch and delete
methods for alarms, alarm definitions and notification methods.  Some
of these tests already existed but this ensures a complete set of
tests exists for these cases.

Move the resource try catch block wrapper to the correct layer
so that it catches all potential Internal Server Errors and throws
the proper exception.

Change-Id: I07159d0eaed995518bb0c0e2fbf446dff65ec632

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 05:15:29.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': "Fix volatile CPU 'size'

The 'size' parameter for CPU returned by lshw is current CPU clock
which changes constantly breaking nailgun optimization which expects
hw data to not change each time.
This also must reduce probability of deadlocks in #1624230.

Change-Id: I7d9b5282991b17424d458c2612dfa4eeeb52be48
Partial-Bug: #1624230
(cherry picked from commit 5e7127f9ec13c0ed0e62b9d9150d835ca2a27b72)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix volatile CPU 'size'

The 'size' parameter for CPU returned by lshw is current CPU clock
which changes constantly breaking nailgun optimization which expects
hw data to not change each time.
This also must reduce probability of deadlocks in #1624230.

Change-Id: I7d9b5282991b17424d458c2612dfa4eeeb52be48
Partial-Bug: #1624230
(cherry picked from commit 5e7127f9ec13c0ed0e62b9d9150d835ca2a27b72)

subject: Specifies gabbi version in test-requirements.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-29 13:45:58.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Specifies gabbi version in test-requirements.txt

Because of the modification of the handlers module in gabbi 1.26,
the python2.7 gate jobs did not work properly. This patch specifies that
the gabbi version must be inferior to 1.26.

Change-Id: I69f93959f30a829d746da24a17c10c8f75d60d6a
Closes-Bug: 1628930
'}]
commit_message:
Specifies gabbi version in test-requirements.txt

Because of the modification of the handlers module in gabbi 1.26,
the python2.7 gate jobs did not work properly. This patch specifies that
the gabbi version must be inferior to 1.26.

Change-Id: I69f93959f30a829d746da24a17c10c8f75d60d6a
Closes-Bug: 1628930

subject: TrivialFix: Use os_cache instead of no_cache
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-30 21:46:19.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/util/__init__.py'], 'message': "TrivialFix: Use os_cache instead of no_cache

From the logs of a gate run I saw this UserWarning

UserWarning: The 'no_cache' argument is deprecated in Ocata and its
use may result in errors in future releases. Use 'os_cache' instead.

I found only one instance of no_cache in trove, so I am updating
it to os_cache at the Warning's request.

os_cache is false as you can see they flip the logic
in the parsing logic
python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/client.py#L314

Change-Id: I9f9feb09340cbe6d9dd4a7a6cfce3f8684db1b4c
"}]
commit_message:
TrivialFix: Use os_cache instead of no_cache

From the logs of a gate run I saw this UserWarning

UserWarning: The 'no_cache' argument is deprecated in Ocata and its
use may result in errors in future releases. Use 'os_cache' instead.

I found only one instance of no_cache in trove, so I am updating
it to os_cache at the Warning's request.

os_cache is false as you can see they flip the logic
in the parsing logic
python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/client.py#L314

Change-Id: I9f9feb09340cbe6d9dd4a7a6cfce3f8684db1b4c

commit_message:
indexer: fix resource type update

Currently when we update a resource type the history table is broken
because a column is missing.

This change fixes that.

Closes-bug: #1649261
Change-Id: I938c7263824bae0a01634fa48fa784a91ae49499

commit_message:
Fetch unread notifications number

Replace 20sec polling of the whole notification collection
by polling of notification statistics (GET /api/notifications/stats)
which includes number of unread notifications.
This number is rendered in notifications badge in Fuel UI.

Also, notifications are marked as read by a new handler
PUT /api/notifications/change_status with {status: 'read'} payload.

Partial-Bug: #1657348

Depends-On: I2e6a0daaf8712ab3064df728a8fb463ef805aa06

Change-Id: I6a7eae7abf2b43143039db7ca262ae40ce5a30b4

commit_message:
Simplify uses of assert_has_calls

Change I40d2800ea9dacd65cfa54d61c49746f7abbd1a5b introduced some calls
too assert_has_calls, instead use assert_called_once_with as its simpler
in cases where a method has only been called once.

commit_message:
Update the rabbitmq modules to use the node name

This change adds the rabbitmq node name to the rabbitmq
libs. This is needed to ensure the rabbitmq cli commands
are connecting to an explicite cluster name without any
assumptions.

Change-Id: I32de32c3972563ca2351be12f221fd2f11de20d0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 35b4ae001936b54febeb3b02f2a685a33201b0c9)

[{'number': 44, 'created': '2017-01-13 15:51:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/conf/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-minimum-bandwidth-support-linuxbridge-9dc9d4458d8affef.yaml', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_tc_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/resources/client.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_tc_lib.py', 'etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/linuxbridge-plugin.filters', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/extension_drivers/qos_driver.py', 'doc/source/devref/quality_of_service.rst', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/mech_driver/mech_linuxbridge.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/test_qos.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/tc_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/extension_drivers/test_qos_driver.py'], 'message': 'Linux Bridge: driver support for QoS egress minimum bandwidth

This patch provides the Linux Bridge agent driver the ability to control
Linux Traffic Control (TC) to set the minimum required transmission rate
for an interface.

The TC library is refactored to use HTB qdiscs. This allows TC to
define, for several flows in the same interface, the maximum and the
minimum network bandwidth and the burst size.

To be able to do traffic shaping (instead of policing) for ingress
traffic, a new element, the Intermediate Functional Block device (IFB)
is introduced.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #1560963

Change-Id: I4d4db54519f1435068d1af38819404d1e5d9cd52
'}]
commit_message:
Linux Bridge: driver support for QoS egress minimum bandwidth

This patch provides the Linux Bridge agent driver the ability to control
Linux Traffic Control (TC) to set the minimum required transmission rate
for an interface.

The TC library is refactored to use HTB qdiscs. This allows TC to
define, for several flows in the same interface, the maximum and the
minimum network bandwidth and the burst size.

To be able to do traffic shaping (instead of policing) for ingress
traffic, a new element, the Intermediate Functional Block device (IFB)
is introduced.

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #1560963

Change-Id: I4d4db54519f1435068d1af38819404d1e5d9cd52

different PODs and services. Dynamic DNS allows discovering of an actual

Partially-Implements: blueprint kolla-kubernetes-service-discovery

commit_message:
WIP Adds Dynamic DNS functionality to k8s cluster

Even in AIO setup, we need to discover IP addresses allocated to
different PODs and services. Dynamic DNS allows discovering of an actual
IP address of a service or a pod by its symbolic name.

Change-Id: Iab8f6ae18a48d9ae0625807581a13d35e2e248cb
Partially-Implements: blueprint kolla-kubernetes-service-discovery

Changes add flag --post-mortem to use post-mortem debugging.

It can be used as:
nova-manage --post-mortem <category> <command>

Change-Id: Ib8ab99fc6bc543500a862f414d7df763568b9b2d
"}]
commit_message:
Add debug possibility for nova-manage command

Sometimes if an error occurs it's good to have the ability to debug it.
Changes add flag --post-mortem to use post-mortem debugging.

It can be used as:
nova-manage --post-mortem <category> <command>

Change-Id: Ib8ab99fc6bc543500a862f414d7df763568b9b2d

subject: Add release note for git_config_lookup_location
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 11:03:47.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/ceilometer_upstream_file_retrieve-bbbf147cdeacb8f2.yaml'], 'message': "Add release note for git_config_lookup_location

Although the feature doesn't impact upgrades or users experiences, we
now expose the option to adjust the git repository that is required to
retrieve the configuration files.

This feature is important for deployers with no access out (except for
from the repo host for example), so we should add a releasenote to bring
attention to this.

Change-Id: I0f0ab474a7ac86fd0273949b54be6c0ad4a89721
(cherry picked from commit 37890ba89a835476bcca3b678133191c365258ed)
"}]
commit_message:
Add release note for git_config_lookup_location

Although the feature doesn't impact upgrades or users experiences, we
now expose the option to adjust the git repository that is required to
retrieve the configuration files.

This feature is important for deployers with no access out (except for
from the repo host for example), so we should add a releasenote to bring
attention to this.

Change-Id: I0f0ab474a7ac86fd0273949b54be6c0ad4a89721
(cherry picked from commit 37890ba89a835476bcca3b678133191c365258ed)

commit_message:
Improve tunnel_sync

When start ovs-agent, method tunnel_sync will call
_setup_tunnel_port when l2_pop is not enabled.
For each tunnel _setup_tunnel_port will be called once,
every call will add flood flows to br-tun. But one time
call is enough.

Change-Id: I80f25edb35a89c5476f5216e151a27cbd3dcd120
Co-Authored-By: Yan Xing an <yanxingan@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Closes-bug: #1589400
(cherry picked from commit 3a612fc870cd044e126c0f66a484e696318ae9cb)

The HostPciSRIOVDevicesInfo test object provided a 'create_pci_devices'
function that did what '__init__' usually does. Adopt the principle of

Change-Id: I7723cfb6a2d2699d809739a4b03c46a300222897
"}]
commit_message:
tests: Don't reinvent __init__

The HostPciSRIOVDevicesInfo test object provided a 'create_pci_devices'
function that did what '__init__' usually does. Adopt the principle of
least suprise and just use '__init__' directly.

Change-Id: I7723cfb6a2d2699d809739a4b03c46a300222897

subject: Fix AZ List Detail schema to allow hosts as None
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 06:55:33.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/availability_zone.py'], 'message': 'Fix AZ List Detail schema to allow hosts as None

List AZ with Details response can return host as None
for non available AZ from nova.

But response schema [1] always expect host as non-None
value which is not true for non available AZ on nova side.

Change-Id: I015ea26eb47ef179d55f3e452e871bfeec406365
Closes-Bug: #1662781
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AZ List Detail schema to allow hosts as None

List AZ with Details response can return host as None
for non available AZ from nova.

But response schema [1] always expect host as non-None
value which is not true for non available AZ on nova side.

Change-Id: I015ea26eb47ef179d55f3e452e871bfeec406365
Closes-Bug: #1662781

subject: Set deploy driver to fake for ironicclient functional job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 11:28:09.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml'], 'message': 'Set deploy driver to fake for ironicclient functional job

A new check was introduced in ironic devstack plugin ensuring
IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER is in
${IRONIC_ENABLED_DRIVERS},${IRONIC_ENABLED_HARDWARE_TYPES} list.
By default it is pxe_ssh, explicitly set it to fake for client job.

Change-Id: Id84f51f81063d12c0af9e5396edc7a6ebfc0c1c8
'}]
commit_message:
Set deploy driver to fake for ironicclient functional job

A new check was introduced in ironic devstack plugin ensuring
IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER is in
${IRONIC_ENABLED_DRIVERS},${IRONIC_ENABLED_HARDWARE_TYPES} list.
By default it is pxe_ssh, explicitly set it to fake for client job.

Change-Id: Id84f51f81063d12c0af9e5396edc7a6ebfc0c1c8

commit_message:
Change default collect_statistics_interval to 30s

By default, the management plugin collects statistics every 5 seconds.
This modifies it to 30s in order to alleviate memory pressure. This
value is only considered when the management plugin is enabled.

Change-Id: I7dbbcfc1cbc0a17c6a3c421914883e52cf74afb5
Closes-Bug: 1656074

commit_message:
Implementing stricter permissions on config files

The security guide suggests that all OpenStack service config files
should be owned by root and in the service user group with 0640 permissions.

http://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/networking/checklist.html

Change-Id: I603eb691828bb3456ae0686ed80342765f52ecea

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I06e33811a907ef6fc0758de70d544cea673b1fa3

subject: Target unbound component group instead of _all
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 18:59:58.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/unbound-install.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml'], 'message': 'Target unbound component group instead of _all

The unbound container group and component group share the same name,
so we are hitting the quirk in OSA inventory where containerized
services that have component and container groups sharing the same
name get both the hosts and containers added to the _all group.

This change targets the component group to correctly target only
the unbound containers, not the physical hosts for the containers.

Change-Id: Id214bbebeee73a6bf48088396e2e450669e00926
'}]
commit_message:
Target unbound component group instead of _all

The unbound container group and component group share the same name,
so we are hitting the quirk in OSA inventory where containerized
services that have component and container groups sharing the same
name get both the hosts and containers added to the _all group.

This change targets the component group to correctly target only
the unbound containers, not the physical hosts for the containers.

Change-Id: Id214bbebeee73a6bf48088396e2e450669e00926

commit_message:
Enable Keystone v3 support for nova_flavor and nova_aggregate

Both providers were previously using Credentialsv2_0, which do not
work in a Keystone v3 environment (and that's what we should be
using today).

Change-Id: Ib1509b8b5422a8749d7f7689b77dc4abab50dbf7

subject: Moving task cache update into task creation transaction
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12199, 'name': 'Igor Gajsin', 'email': 'igajsin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'igajsin'}, {'_account_id': 18205, 'name': 'Bulat Gaifullin', 'email': 'gaifullinbf@gmail.com', 'username': 'bgaifullin'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-08 11:26:44.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/task/task.py'], 'message': "Moving task cache update into task creation transaction

Doing this we avoid inclusion of task cache update statement into the next
transaction which may cause different problems such as deadlock.
In this particular case we've got the following deadlock:
1. DeleteIBPImagesTask makes UPDATE tasks SET cache....
2. Response handler in receiver makes SELECT clusters FOR UPDATE
3. The code following DeleteIBPImagesTask makes SELECT clusters FOR UPDATE
4. Response handler performs SELECTS tasks FOR UPDATE

Change-Id: Ic8e5f2386364421b0667f920499e031f587f726e
Closes-Bug: #1653083
(cherry picked from commit ff04eb8394d81750608a95bedf6ab8cd5244d5e8)
"}]
commit_message:
Moving task cache update into task creation transaction

Doing this we avoid inclusion of task cache update statement into the next
transaction which may cause different problems such as deadlock.
In this particular case we've got the following deadlock:
1. DeleteIBPImagesTask makes UPDATE tasks SET cache....
2. Response handler in receiver makes SELECT clusters FOR UPDATE
3. The code following DeleteIBPImagesTask makes SELECT clusters FOR UPDATE
4. Response handler performs SELECTS tasks FOR UPDATE

Change-Id: Ic8e5f2386364421b0667f920499e031f587f726e
Closes-Bug: #1653083
(cherry picked from commit ff04eb8394d81750608a95bedf6ab8cd5244d5e8)

commit_message:
Handler for changing notifications statuses added

As workaround for decreasing loading in the UI on unread
notifications fetching we can mark all notifications as read.
For such purposes we add NotificationsMarkAllHandler

Change-Id: I2e6a0daaf8712ab3064df728a8fb463ef805aa06
Partial-Bug: #1657348
(cherry picked from commit 71fb921dbe2a2cc845a4b48f96fb45dcaae6b4fb)

commit_message:
Pass access rules to driver on snapshot revert

In order to revert to a snapshot in the LVM driver (and
very likely other drivers) the list of access rules is
needed, so this change modifies the driver interface to
provide this extra information.

This change requires preventing a revert to snapshot
operation while access rules on the affected share are
out of sync.

Closes bug: 1658133

Change-Id: Ia6678bb0e484f9c8f8b05d90e514801ae9baa94b

commit_message:
Set nodes' statuses to 'error' when their nodegroup is deleted

According to the bug below and the spec, we did not implement
one multirack feature aspect.

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/fuel-specs/specs/8.0/multi-rack-static.html#notifications-impact

Now we add resetting node to error to node group deletion callback and
send a notification.

Change-Id: I6b2bae5601ba7dbca620bb3861e95b0e554f8699
Closes-bug: #1644630

commit_message:
Default some needed variables

These variables are expected to be defined by tripleo-ci scripts. They
are usually defined by the infra generated environment when tripleo-ci
jobs are executed. However, for running tripleo-ci scripts locally, we
need to default them to some sane values.

Change-Id: Ib6b769822522d4328447523e68ff238132b0f561

subject: Revert setup.py >=1.8 constraint for pbr
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-08 13:29:52.000000000', 'files': ['setup.py'], 'message': "Revert setup.py >=1.8 constraint for pbr

This reverts one of the changes made by commit
7ff3bd47f687f587e9537d4e21b72999944a74f6.

With 'pbr>=1.8' in setup.py, Launchpad cannot build networking-calico
for Trusty, because the Trusty archive only has pbr 0.7 (and I was not
able to find any authoritative backports).  In fact I don't believe
there is anything in networking-calico itself that really requires
pbr>=1.8, so relaxing this should allow networking-calico to build for
Trusty.

On the other hand, we still keep the 'pbr>=1.6' constraint in
requirements.txt, for consistency with the OpenStack constraints system.
requirements.txt is not directly involved when a Debian source package
is built and uploaded to Launchpad, and binary packages then built from
that.

Change-Id: If11be6d0f9fb7fab6c7ca4ba776d323486fb1383
"}]
commit_message:
Revert setup.py >=1.8 constraint for pbr

This reverts one of the changes made by commit
7ff3bd47f687f587e9537d4e21b72999944a74f6.

With 'pbr>=1.8' in setup.py, Launchpad cannot build networking-calico
for Trusty, because the Trusty archive only has pbr 0.7 (and I was not
able to find any authoritative backports).  In fact I don't believe
there is anything in networking-calico itself that really requires
pbr>=1.8, so relaxing this should allow networking-calico to build for
Trusty.

On the other hand, we still keep the 'pbr>=1.6' constraint in
requirements.txt, for consistency with the OpenStack constraints system.
requirements.txt is not directly involved when a Debian source package
is built and uploaded to Launchpad, and binary packages then built from
that.

Change-Id: If11be6d0f9fb7fab6c7ca4ba776d323486fb1383

subject: Add release note for git_config_lookup_location
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-08 14:32:47.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/ceilometer_upstream_file_retrieve-bbbf147cdeacb8f2.yaml'], 'message': "Add release note for git_config_lookup_location

Although the feature doesn't impact upgrades or users experiences, we
now expose the option to adjust the git repository that is required to
retrieve the configuration files.

This feature is important for deployers with no access out (except for
from the repo host for example), so we should add a releasenote to bring
attention to this.

Change-Id: I0f0ab474a7ac86fd0273949b54be6c0ad4a89721
"}]
commit_message:
Add release note for git_config_lookup_location

Although the feature doesn't impact upgrades or users experiences, we
now expose the option to adjust the git repository that is required to
retrieve the configuration files.

This feature is important for deployers with no access out (except for
from the repo host for example), so we should add a releasenote to bring
attention to this.

Change-Id: I0f0ab474a7ac86fd0273949b54be6c0ad4a89721

subject: Set the git location url to be the base gnocchi repo
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-07 15:13:48.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/gnocchi_post_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/gnocchi_upstream_file_retrieve-e2a056bfc532d761.yaml'], 'message': 'Set the git location url to be the base gnocchi repo

In the future, if more files are added in different paths, this will
allow us to use an item "path" variable rather than forcing the
"gnocchi/rest" path.

This will help when implementing the solution to use a local repo server
for the conf files in the integrated build.

Additionally, a release note for the upstream repo change has been
added.

Change-Id: I86389c1f7643a0634a85f165f62f089a316f040c
'}]
commit_message:
Set the git location url to be the base gnocchi repo

In the future, if more files are added in different paths, this will
allow us to use an item "path" variable rather than forcing the
"gnocchi/rest" path.

This will help when implementing the solution to use a local repo server
for the conf files in the integrated build.

Additionally, a release note for the upstream repo change has been
added.

Change-Id: I86389c1f7643a0634a85f165f62f089a316f040c

subject: Show team and repo badges on README
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 12:37:05.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'message': "Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/0fa8867697757718c9a122540bef860f\n'

Change-Id: I46fb76ff4083bfe67d54d18c0b6058298731d351

commit_message:
Pass job identifier to testenv-worker

Adds another argument to the call to the te-broker that will allow
us to identify which patch and job a given testenv was used for.

The arguments passed in by the client already get logged on the
te-broker side, which is why there are no changes except in the
client.

Change-Id: I848e08cd272724c059ce92a6ee527dedcd53acce

subject: Make graphite metrics more granular
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 19:09:06.000000000', 'files': ['toci_instack_osinfra.sh', 'toci_instack_ovb.sh', 'scripts/common_functions.sh', 'scripts/deploy.sh', 'toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "Make graphite metrics more granular

Right now, most metrics are recorded the same regardless of branch,
and some ignore the job type as well.  Since many of the metrics
can vary significantly depending on those details (mitaka jobs take
far less time than master, for example), let's separate out the
metrics more.

This change adds a .release.jobtype specifier to most of the
metrics.  The notable exception is the testenv wait time because
that is not release-specific.  Also, the image metrics do not
actually need to be split based on job type since they don't vary,
but for consistency with the other overcloud metrics I did anyway.

With this change we do not lose the ability to look at broader
aggregate numbers either.  We can still combine these newly
separated metrics back together in the Graphite UI.

Change-Id: I1df58f3a0c44708728e6ea1d705a6e8bf49ef330
"}]
commit_message:
Make graphite metrics more granular

Right now, most metrics are recorded the same regardless of branch,
and some ignore the job type as well.  Since many of the metrics
can vary significantly depending on those details (mitaka jobs take
far less time than master, for example), let's separate out the
metrics more.

This change adds a .release.jobtype specifier to most of the
metrics.  The notable exception is the testenv wait time because
that is not release-specific.  Also, the image metrics do not
actually need to be split based on job type since they don't vary,
but for consistency with the other overcloud metrics I did anyway.

With this change we do not lose the ability to look at broader
aggregate numbers either.  We can still combine these newly
separated metrics back together in the Graphite UI.

Change-Id: I1df58f3a0c44708728e6ea1d705a6e8bf49ef330

subject: Prepare for using standard python tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 20:15:56.000000000', 'files': ['tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I93265cd17899e090377cd5399b46ef5c5b86bc75
Needed-By: Ib5a91fd4e7211f4418ca1dc1bd2fa5c31b986bd5
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I93265cd17899e090377cd5399b46ef5c5b86bc75
Needed-By: Ib5a91fd4e7211f4418ca1dc1bd2fa5c31b986bd5

commit_message:
SNAT application - mech driver support

First scheduled compute port on host causes mech driver
to create external port to route tenant sNAT traffic via it.
Same tenant's second or more compute port on host reuses
previously created external port.

Feature enabled with DF parameter:
- enable_addr_alloc_for_snat

Implements: blueprint snat-distribution
Change-Id: I7f6f6547f34f3cf63f323b547e3bf7e528f5bf30

subject: SNAT application - Chassis & Tenant mode
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-09 07:38:43.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/snat_app.py', 'dragonflow/conf/df_snat.py', 'dragonflow/controller/base_snat_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_tenant_snat_app.py', 'dragonflow/conf/__init__.py', 'dragonflow/controller/common/constants.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_app_base.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_snat_app.py', 'dragonflow/controller/tenant_snat_app.py'], 'message': 'SNAT application - Chassis & Tenant mode

This patch combines 2 sNAT modes as described in spec
 - chassis based sNAT
 - tenant chassis based sNAT (requires mech_driver support)

Chassis sNAT mode has 2 configuration parameters
 - external_host_ip
 - external_host_mac
Tenant sNAT mode has extra mech_driver parameter to allocate provider IPs
 - enable_addr_alloc_for_snat

Based on br-ex <-> br-int connector that curently defined by dnat app
and will be further moved to provider_networks app

Implements: blueprint snat-distribution
Change-Id: If53959ed48ed30bf63e35e3796b6892939b02627
'}]
commit_message:
SNAT application - Chassis & Tenant mode

This patch combines 2 sNAT modes as described in spec
 - chassis based sNAT
 - tenant chassis based sNAT (requires mech_driver support)

Chassis sNAT mode has 2 configuration parameters
 - external_host_ip
 - external_host_mac
Tenant sNAT mode has extra mech_driver parameter to allocate provider IPs
 - enable_addr_alloc_for_snat

Based on br-ex <-> br-int connector that curently defined by dnat app
and will be further moved to provider_networks app

Implements: blueprint snat-distribution
Change-Id: If53959ed48ed30bf63e35e3796b6892939b02627

commit_message:
Split configuration astute.yaml into common and node parts

This file is huge if there are many nodes in cluster. Now
we generate it and store in memory for each node and it
takes a lot of time and memory.

Let's split it into common and node-specific parts so that
we can generate common part once and copy it from master
node to each node affected by deployment.

Change-Id: I114a8598460bef9063e43505f46fe38cd564d8c7

Partial-Bug: #1656150

commit_message:
Use explicit path in Xenial

Nobody promised PATH to be set during rc.local execution by systemd. And
it happens that this is the case on some systems, i.e. the PATH is not
set by the time of rc.local execution.

Change-Id: I4806df3217dd09430ad45b13cda49fab0925cb88
Partial-Bug: #1656150

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 10:38:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/vif.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_vif.py', 'nova/virt/netutils.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/firewall.py'], 'message': "WIP: conf: Add 'vif' group

This will be used to replace the nova-network options that libvirt and
Xen have repurposed for configuring their VIFs and related metadata
files.

NOTE(stephenfin): I don't even know if we need to do this. The file
injection of network templates may be going away [1] and while we still
need to keep Libvirt network filters around for now, we could remedy the
situation by ensuring neutron *always* applies port filters. Also note
that Libvirt network filters don't apply if using security groups,
native OVS ports (which don't support IPTables), or if neutron does
indeed request port filtering.

Change-Id: Ic67f8272db9087504147285004a5355f4ba7b03a
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-pike
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: conf: Add 'vif' group

This will be used to replace the nova-network options that libvirt and
Xen have repurposed for configuring their VIFs and related metadata
files.

NOTE(stephenfin): I don't even know if we need to do this. The file
injection of network templates may be going away [1] and while we still
need to keep Libvirt network filters around for now, we could remedy the
situation by ensuring neutron *always* applies port filters. Also note
that Libvirt network filters don't apply if using security groups,
native OVS ports (which don't support IPTables), or if neutron does
indeed request port filtering.

Change-Id: Ic67f8272db9087504147285004a5355f4ba7b03a
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-pike

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to

'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I5f35676122d8c42944b4d2b7299f786bd0e15f92

commit_message:
Add reno for release notes management

OpenStack projects use reno [1] to publish their release notes.

This patch adds a releasenotes directory with the initial layout for
building Blazar release notes. The build process is done with:

    tox -e releasenotes

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/release-management.html#managing-release-notes

Change-Id: I22c6a842d16dde14c3d72010fe54e439961b3e66
Partial-Bug: #1658859

* Added capability to use tempest rpm

commit_message:
Enable using tempest rpm in a configurable mode

* TEMPEST_FROM_SOURCE is set to true to install tempest from source.
* Added capability to use tempest rpm
* change the cirros image directory to /tmp/openstack/image
  if the image gets firstly downloaded in tempest workspace,
  Tempest init will fail to create tempest workspace.
* Create image_dir if not exists.

Change-Id: I349783ace314a3575e93e6c853a7756f0f9b85ac

subject: Prepare for using standard python tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 20:16:32.000000000', 'files': ['tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I93265cd17899e090377cd5399b46ef5c5b86bc75
Needed-By: Ib5a91fd4e7211f4418ca1dc1bd2fa5c31b986bd5
(cherry picked from commit ac4d52bd4c16abb87a86338213afef6b96ae00f5)
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I93265cd17899e090377cd5399b46ef5c5b86bc75
Needed-By: Ib5a91fd4e7211f4418ca1dc1bd2fa5c31b986bd5
(cherry picked from commit ac4d52bd4c16abb87a86338213afef6b96ae00f5)

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 01:56:49.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/api.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ia082e1a64efbd5f3e9dc6830f14181cb30a11fd2
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ia082e1a64efbd5f3e9dc6830f14181cb30a11fd2

subject: Remove support for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 08:24:16.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I1b38e10119a5c9126147a661c55582092338e259
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I1b38e10119a5c9126147a661c55582092338e259

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

Update devref for this.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I845c04b32c6b2bba055829cb2100f5beba94de4d
Needed-By: I4f2ce44f9e28c94d6562d5c520c00c35207f7123

commit_message:
Fix failure ratio format in charts

This commit fixes the failure ratio formats in some charts. Failure
ratios are between 0 and 0.2 in most of the case. So the float numbers
should have more accuracy to know exact values.

Change-Id: I26350bf8b7ff586242f99ec7ab171472f16a188c

subject: OSA: Re-implement func test jobs for stable/mitaka
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-06 11:32:50.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'OSA: Re-implement func test jobs for stable/mitaka

The intent of https://review.openstack.org/428691 was to
reduce the scope of functional test jobs running against
the stable/mitaka branch, but it reduced the job set to
zero unintentionally. Effectively those jobs are only
run against the stable/newton branch now.

This patch returns the previous include, then remodels
the inclusion before it into an exclusion after it so
that there is only one inclusion for trusty, then follow
on filters exclude the jobs that should not run against
stable/mitaka. This should achieve the goal of only
running the limited job set against mitaka, and also
supporting trusty for newton.

The CentOS job restriction further down in the file is
removed as the same functionality is now consolidated
into the new skip rule by virtue of the fact that it will
skip all non trusty jobs.

Change-Id: Ieb14a7bb49a2c3e5aaa0c169ee179d8087fa4711
'}]
commit_message:
OSA: Re-implement func test jobs for stable/mitaka

The intent of https://review.openstack.org/428691 was to
reduce the scope of functional test jobs running against
the stable/mitaka branch, but it reduced the job set to
zero unintentionally. Effectively those jobs are only
run against the stable/newton branch now.

This patch returns the previous include, then remodels
the inclusion before it into an exclusion after it so
that there is only one inclusion for trusty, then follow
on filters exclude the jobs that should not run against
stable/mitaka. This should achieve the goal of only
running the limited job set against mitaka, and also
supporting trusty for newton.

The CentOS job restriction further down in the file is
removed as the same functionality is now consolidated
into the new skip rule by virtue of the fact that it will
skip all non trusty jobs.

Change-Id: Ieb14a7bb49a2c3e5aaa0c169ee179d8087fa4711

subject: Demote trunk gating job to experimental
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 10:16:29.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Demote trunk gating job to experimental

The trunk gating job is a NOOP and is wasting infrastructure
resources.  We have a very aggresisve experimental->non-voting
promotion process for jobs.  Once the job is completed in our
gating scripts, we will promote it again.  Becaue of our aggressive
promotion process for experimental to gating jobs, experimental is
rarely run and jobs only sit in this queue for about a week.

Change-Id: Idf65c19de814876b84512ae4c66cd9d63699a07a
'}]
commit_message:
Demote trunk gating job to experimental

The trunk gating job is a NOOP and is wasting infrastructure
resources.  We have a very aggresisve experimental->non-voting
promotion process for jobs.  Once the job is completed in our
gating scripts, we will promote it again.  Becaue of our aggressive
promotion process for experimental to gating jobs, experimental is
rarely run and jobs only sit in this queue for about a week.

Change-Id: Idf65c19de814876b84512ae4c66cd9d63699a07a

commit_message:
convert uids to list before passing to make_*_task

RoleResolver returns set of uids, but functions, which
make tasks want list.

(cherry picked from commit 68c0d42ae03f137589d38c94b5e7274b8eec8525)

commit_message:
Raise multiple minimum XStatic versions

Several of these packages are no longer compatible at their current
minimum versions. This patch raises the minimums to match
upper-constraints (effectively fixing the version number)

commit_message:
Handler for changing notifications statuses added

As workaround for decreasing loading in the UI on unread
notifications fetching we can mark all notifications as read.
For such purposes we add NotificationsMarkAllHandler

Change-Id: I2e6a0daaf8712ab3064df728a8fb463ef805aa06
Partial-Bug: #1657348
