commit_message:
Limit number of fetched notifications

This change depends on fuel-web:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/424380/

This change limits the amount of notifications fetched from API

*WIP, most likely breaks the counter of new notifications.
*Maybe implement a separate call to get the number of new notifications from API?
*This will need some extra func added in fuel-web

Closes-Bug: 1657348

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 03:26:53.000000000', 'files': ['etc/oslo-config-generator/searchlight.conf'], 'message': 'Replace keystone middleware in conf generator

The auth_token middleware is no longer in keystoneclient, which
results an warning if you use it to generate searchlight conf.
Replace the module with keystonemiddleware.

Change-Id: Ifbb06e45005f22f13f3dfa72e5b7a2c3e4269311
Closes-bug: #1662509
'}]
commit_message:
Replace keystone middleware in conf generator

The auth_token middleware is no longer in keystoneclient, which
results an warning if you use it to generate searchlight conf.
Replace the module with keystonemiddleware.

Change-Id: Ifbb06e45005f22f13f3dfa72e5b7a2c3e4269311
Closes-bug: #1662509

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 06:38:40.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I079fec9ab570cb79e975db8f0f00aa7d53f0219b

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

subject: Prepare for using standard python tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 20:18:01.000000000', 'files': ['tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I93265cd17899e090377cd5399b46ef5c5b86bc75
Needed-By: Ib5a91fd4e7211f4418ca1dc1bd2fa5c31b986bd5
(cherry picked from commit ac4d52bd4c16abb87a86338213afef6b96ae00f5)
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I93265cd17899e090377cd5399b46ef5c5b86bc75
Needed-By: Ib5a91fd4e7211f4418ca1dc1bd2fa5c31b986bd5
(cherry picked from commit ac4d52bd4c16abb87a86338213afef6b96ae00f5)

Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

we have retired oslo-incubator,so don't use this directory any more.

subject: Resolved Keystone Federation bugs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 11:20:45.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'library/keystone_sp', 'tasks/keystone_federation_sp_setup.yml'], 'message': 'Resolved Keystone Federation bugs

The keystone role needed a few updates to deal with modern Ansible.

  * The changeset pulls in the needed updates to resolve issues causing
    the keystone_sp plugin, which powers federation, to crash.
  * The changeset pulls in style changes for keystone cert sync removing
    the need for the role to leverage the now deprecated memcached key
    module.

Closes-Bug: 1660626

Change-Id: I29d444c9631a7511123aa6cd521a20a0e7588645
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit a6ee6100c5c1dfc3c0657af19652e30d5bbdde74)
'}]
commit_message:
Resolved Keystone Federation bugs

The keystone role needed a few updates to deal with modern Ansible.

  * The changeset pulls in the needed updates to resolve issues causing
    the keystone_sp plugin, which powers federation, to crash.
  * The changeset pulls in style changes for keystone cert sync removing
    the need for the role to leverage the now deprecated memcached key
    module.

Closes-Bug: 1660626

Change-Id: I29d444c9631a7511123aa6cd521a20a0e7588645
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit a6ee6100c5c1dfc3c0657af19652e30d5bbdde74)

subject: Remove support for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 02:19:59.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I13843698703a8502a7220516a70cb228ce2c287f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I13843698703a8502a7220516a70cb228ce2c287f

Because of the wrong usage of sed command, we cannot deploy zun

commit_message:
Ensure the plugin of zun for devstack can work on ubuntu 14

Because of the wrong usage of sed command, we cannot deploy zun
with devstack on ubuntu 14. This patch aims to fix this problem.

Change-Id: I7a6ea3ccf3dda1429d37974e6c142b4b1d97865d
Close-Bug: #1662788

subject: Prepare for using standard python tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 20:17:38.000000000', 'files': ['tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I93265cd17899e090377cd5399b46ef5c5b86bc75
Needed-By: Ib5a91fd4e7211f4418ca1dc1bd2fa5c31b986bd5
(cherry picked from commit ac4d52bd4c16abb87a86338213afef6b96ae00f5)
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I93265cd17899e090377cd5399b46ef5c5b86bc75
Needed-By: Ib5a91fd4e7211f4418ca1dc1bd2fa5c31b986bd5
(cherry picked from commit ac4d52bd4c16abb87a86338213afef6b96ae00f5)

commit_message:
Unbind tenant ports before rebuild

Currently, during rebuild, tenant ports are bound to tenant network
when we call add_provisioning_network. We need to unbind them first.

Closes-Bug: #1657083
Change-Id: I475a089ee646872f7874c3d257c1dc571ea94f4d

commit_message:
Added support for stdout/stderr options in logs

Docker logs has two options: stdout and stderr.
It would be helpful to add that option to zun
logs command. Solum has a use case for that.

Closes-Bug: #1661749

Change-Id: Ie5cde12f35922c16c73f78fa2dae7013ff64dee7

subject: Consider startup scenario in _get_compute_nodes_in_db
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte OpenStack CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16897, 'name': 'Virtuozzo Storage CI', 'email': 'vzstorage-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'vzstorage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 15:26:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Consider startup scenario in _get_compute_nodes_in_db

Before this change, on the first start of the nova-compute
service on any host, this method is logging the
"No compute node record for host" error which is confusing
for people debugging issues. For example, if the compute
service starts up before the Placement service is running,
the compute is checking in and failing to connect to the
placement endpoint which might take the compute node out
of consideration for scheduling. When debugging that kind
of issue, people can get hung up on this error message
which is actually an expected case on the first start of
nova-compute on a new host.

This change simply plumbs through a boolean to tell it
if we're starting up or not. This doesn't tell us if
it's the first time we're starting this service or a
restart, but the thinking is, if it's a restart we don't
get the NotFound error and if we do, then we do want the
error level message.

Change-Id: Id7a05b579ead6ac5445ca5b1eeab6d223d545a6c
'}]
commit_message:
Consider startup scenario in _get_compute_nodes_in_db

Before this change, on the first start of the nova-compute
service on any host, this method is logging the
"No compute node record for host" error which is confusing
for people debugging issues. For example, if the compute
service starts up before the Placement service is running,
the compute is checking in and failing to connect to the
placement endpoint which might take the compute node out
of consideration for scheduling. When debugging that kind
of issue, people can get hung up on this error message
which is actually an expected case on the first start of
nova-compute on a new host.

This change simply plumbs through a boolean to tell it
if we're starting up or not. This doesn't tell us if
it's the first time we're starting this service or a
restart, but the thinking is, if it's a restart we don't
get the NotFound error and if we do, then we do want the
error level message.

Change-Id: Id7a05b579ead6ac5445ca5b1eeab6d223d545a6c

commit_message:
WIP: _user_domain fix (avoids loop if with noauth)

This avoids the AttributeError which can occur if _user_domain
is unset. Need to investigate more why Heat is trying to use
this data from within the initialization code
(self._load_keystone_data()) that calls it.

Change-Id: I98d9ce1c28895f5b6371ba46064869f429bb4849
Related-bug: #1663013

commit_message:
RBD: non-authentication should be taken into account.

If volume backend does not configure authentication,
when creating backup for a volume using ceph.py as
driver, it will fail to create incremental backup.
Thus, ceph without authentication should be taken
into account.

Change-Id: I188872f36bfadcf0adf91ef838bf22efdf8308b2
Closes-Bug: #1661788

commit_message:
Add network az_hints check when boot vm

1. What is the problem
when boot a vm, if the vm's network is not located in the specified
region, the VM can still be created successfully.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Converted the network's az_hints to region_name in the central plugin and
judge whether the network located in current region in the local plugin.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

Change-Id: Ie8c28b7956e1451fb51745864385a5ddefc9cbea

commit_message:
Add 'consistent_snapshot_support' attr to 'share_groups' DB model

It will be required for support of 'consistent share group snapshots'
feature. It is added in Ocata to ease future possible backports.
Make it be 'Enum' with possible values 'pool', 'host' allowing to be
nullable.

Change-Id: I2e5984bc2fc4a487793ad8254c5dbfb0d6e33f26
Partial-Bug: #1661266
Partial-Bug: #1661268

because it may be used later.

subject: Semi-automatic doc generation of element dependency
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-08 22:51:53.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/debian-upstart/README.rst', 'diskimage_builder/elements/ubuntu/README.rst', 'diskimage_builder/elements/ubuntu-core/README.rst', 'diskimage_builder/elements/dpkg/README.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/doc-auto-element-dependency-cb7488c5bb7301a4.yaml', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'diskimage_builder/element_dependencies.py', 'diskimage_builder/elements/debian-minimal/README.rst', 'diskimage_builder/elements/debian-systemd/README.rst', 'diskimage_builder/elements/debootstrap/README.rst', 'doc/lib/element_deps.py', 'diskimage_builder/elements/ubuntu-minimal/README.rst', 'tox.ini', 'diskimage_builder/elements/debian/README.rst'], 'message': "Semi-automatic doc generation of element dependency

Currently there is no description of dependencies in the generated
documentation of the elements: therefore a user of an element does not
know which other elements are automatically included and e.g. which
configuration options are available. In addition there are some
copy&pastes of parts of the README.rst scattered thought different
Ubuntu and Debian specific elements.

This patch adds a semi-automatic generation of dependency information
of all elements.  Nevertheless these are not automatically included.
The author of the element's README.rst can decide if and where the
dependency information should appear and can use the descriptor

.. element_deps::

for this.

This patch adds the dependency information for some Debian and
Ubuntu patches - and creates the base for later removing the
duplicated parts.

A call is added to element_dependencies._find_all_elements() to
populate reverse dependencies for Element objects.

(This is a reworking of I31d2b6050b6c46fefe37378698e9a330025db430 for
the feature/v2 branch)

Change-Id: Iebb83916fed71565071246baa550849eef40560b
"}]
commit_message:
Semi-automatic doc generation of element dependency

Currently there is no description of dependencies in the generated
documentation of the elements: therefore a user of an element does not
know which other elements are automatically included and e.g. which
configuration options are available. In addition there are some
copy&pastes of parts of the README.rst scattered thought different
Ubuntu and Debian specific elements.

This patch adds a semi-automatic generation of dependency information
of all elements.  Nevertheless these are not automatically included.
The author of the element's README.rst can decide if and where the
dependency information should appear and can use the descriptor

.. element_deps::

for this.

This patch adds the dependency information for some Debian and
Ubuntu patches - and creates the base for later removing the
duplicated parts.

A call is added to element_dependencies._find_all_elements() to
populate reverse dependencies for Element objects.

(This is a reworking of I31d2b6050b6c46fefe37378698e9a330025db430 for
the feature/v2 branch)

Change-Id: Iebb83916fed71565071246baa550849eef40560b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 08:31:47.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ifd029444a083550e79ad02e2b43b684d028eab8e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ifd029444a083550e79ad02e2b43b684d028eab8e

commit_message:
Modify novaclient check for include releases prior to 6.x.x

The current novaclient version check in get-overcloud-nodes.py.j2
only considers version 6.x.x and older.
According to  https://releases.openstack.org/teams/nova.html,
releases prior to Newton could have novaclient versions earlier
than 6.x.x.
To support these versions (including RHOS-9 and Mitaka), this
review changes the version check.

Change-Id: I3e8da51a3a7d6200058c4af4f45f1b324b29545e

IO Priority support on the AArch64 architecture

by getting the correct __NR_ioprio_set value.

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I5191afb3e8c0fff9f82cb2d937343a67348c9c34
Needed-By: I5ca756d8aeb4fe90fd4ca7ac381a7f684b5c56fb
(cherry picked from commit b628acec24b256c7121f1fe85e0a2ab25fe335df)

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2017-01-16 17:21:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': "Add nova-manage cell_v2 create_cell command

Currently, all of the commands that create a new cell require the
presence of compute hosts, else they won't create a cell mapping.
In the use case of a fresh install, it's reasonable that compute
host records may not yet exist at the time of cells v2 setup.

This provides a way for operators to create a new empty cell at
setup time and defer adding hosts to the cell until they have
started their compute hosts later (via the 'discover_hosts'
command).

The command optionally accepts a database connection url and
message queue transport url, else it will take the values from
the nova.conf. It returns the uuid of the newly created cell.

Change-Id: I2fd7d854ffa579e550f6002cfb7223d7f40acac6
Related-Bug: #1656276
"}]
commit_message:
Add nova-manage cell_v2 create_cell command

Currently, all of the commands that create a new cell require the
presence of compute hosts, else they won't create a cell mapping.
In the use case of a fresh install, it's reasonable that compute
host records may not yet exist at the time of cells v2 setup.

This provides a way for operators to create a new empty cell at
setup time and defer adding hosts to the cell until they have
started their compute hosts later (via the 'discover_hosts'
command).

The command optionally accepts a database connection url and
message queue transport url, else it will take the values from
the nova.conf. It returns the uuid of the newly created cell.

Change-Id: I2fd7d854ffa579e550f6002cfb7223d7f40acac6
Related-Bug: #1656276

This will now run bashate on all shell scripts. We could ignore the
following list of bashate errors:

- E006: Line longer than 79 columns (as many scripts use jinja
        templating, this is very difficult)
- E040: Syntax error determined using `bash -n` (as many scripts
        use jinja templating, this will often fail and the syntax
        error will be discovered in execution anyway)

Change-Id: I6f6d454ac54a0ac98d8b8a092fa522cba092a592
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Adds a Bashate target to tox.ini.

This will now run bashate on all shell scripts. We could ignore the
following list of bashate errors:

- E006: Line longer than 79 columns (as many scripts use jinja
        templating, this is very difficult)
- E040: Syntax error determined using `bash -n` (as many scripts
        use jinja templating, this will often fail and the syntax
        error will be discovered in execution anyway)

Change-Id: I6f6d454ac54a0ac98d8b8a092fa522cba092a592
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger

interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-06 23:07:06.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/provision_v3.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/masking.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/provision.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/test_vmax.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/common.py'], 'message': 'VMAX driver - widen locking around storage groups

There is an issue around the locking of storage groups.
There is insufficent locking when multiple processes may
be adding and removing volumes from the same storage group
e.g. deleting the last replicated volume while another
process is creating one. This patch rectifies this issue.

Change-Id: I0138ace1e3d8f1e62d5422864481221915907a25
Closes-Bug: #1660374
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - widen locking around storage groups

There is an issue around the locking of storage groups.
There is insufficent locking when multiple processes may
be adding and removing volumes from the same storage group
e.g. deleting the last replicated volume while another
process is creating one. This patch rectifies this issue.

Change-Id: I0138ace1e3d8f1e62d5422864481221915907a25
Closes-Bug: #1660374

Adds the implied roles API calls to the roles_client library:
create, get, check and delete inference rules.

This will enable the possibility to create additional identity

specific roles.

Change-Id: I1587eb862fac5b533aa4715334d54c86d9af85ff
'}]
commit_message:
Implied roles methods

Adds the implied roles API calls to the roles_client library:
create, get, check and delete inference rules.

This will enable the possibility to create additional identity
API tests for some features, like implied roles and domain
specific roles.

Change-Id: I1587eb862fac5b533aa4715334d54c86d9af85ff

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 06:30:30.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove a py34 environment from tox

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Id8a9dda9ea25b47afc35e0605f4df2f3f22c5f38
'}]
commit_message:
Remove a py34 environment from tox

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Id8a9dda9ea25b47afc35e0605f4df2f3f22c5f38

subject: Fixed warning when building keystone docs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 17:26:15.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/resource_options.py'], 'message': "Fixed warning when building keystone docs

When testing keystone docs for the upcoming pbr release which
fixes warnerror, this warning was coming up:

keystone/keystone/common/resource_options.py:docstring of
keystone.common.resource_options.resource_options_ref_to_mapper:6:
WARNING: Inline literal start-string without end-string.

This change adds the missing '`' in the docstring and the
warning no longer appears.

Change-Id: I27073bcc4a0af69c906b12696a9949a103336aba
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed warning when building keystone docs

When testing keystone docs for the upcoming pbr release which
fixes warnerror, this warning was coming up:

keystone/keystone/common/resource_options.py:docstring of
keystone.common.resource_options.resource_options_ref_to_mapper:6:
WARNING: Inline literal start-string without end-string.

This change adds the missing '`' in the docstring and the
warning no longer appears.

Change-Id: I27073bcc4a0af69c906b12696a9949a103336aba

commit_message:
tripleo-inventory: fix overcloud node fetch for mitaka

Mitaka has older than 6.x python-tripleoclient, so the current check for
it does not work. This fix is needed for anything below 7.x.

commit_message:
Make collect_logs less error prone.

Include a marker file in collect_logs to ensure the dir is poplulated
If the collected_logs directory is empty it appears that collect_logs
could fail later on in the publish rsync command.  Ensure the directory
is populated.

Ensure rsync is installed prior to executing rsync

Change-Id: I67870551448b28b2bede9347cf340244074f9ae2

subject: Fix get-overcloud-nodes.py to work with Mitaka
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-08 18:50:04.000000000', 'files': ['roles/tripleo-inventory/templates/get-overcloud-nodes.py.j2'], 'message': ' Fix get-overcloud-nodes.py to work with Mitaka

In If76afe56f3ff851089732748693f7d2dbd06e59e we updated the
get-overcloud-nodes.py script with a fix taken from instack-undercloud.

However, instack-undercloud is branched, so it did not need any logic
checking what version of novaclient is installed (hence TODO on bit of
logic in that patch).

In tripleo-quickstart we support all upstream releases from a single
branch, so we need to add some extra logic to get the novaclient
initialization signature correct for the particular version of
novaclient being used.

Change-Id: I9586a7f6957d81c279fbac38ec5a2688900b510a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix get-overcloud-nodes.py to work with Mitaka

In If76afe56f3ff851089732748693f7d2dbd06e59e we updated the
get-overcloud-nodes.py script with a fix taken from instack-undercloud.

However, instack-undercloud is branched, so it did not need any logic
checking what version of novaclient is installed (hence TODO on bit of
logic in that patch).

In tripleo-quickstart we support all upstream releases from a single
branch, so we need to add some extra logic to get the novaclient
initialization signature correct for the particular version of
novaclient being used.

Change-Id: I9586a7f6957d81c279fbac38ec5a2688900b510a

commit_message:
Fix and improve flake8 test.

Previously the 'flake8' command was running but didn't seem to
check out something in all cases.

- This patch decouples the 'ansible-lint' and the 'flake8' sections
  into separated 'testenv'.
- And this patch fixes all the 'flake8' issues.

Change-Id: I30169598d086515121175ca322882ee00f05b913
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move FakeStorletFile* from tests to stolets/tools

This is prep for the fundamentaly dry-run supports in ipython extension.

The classes FakeStorletFile* in the unit test cases should be useful to run
in local environment so move them under the packaging directry (i.e.
storlets/tools/testtools.py), and then let's use them in our python
storlet local environment.

And add some unit tests to get them into the storlets package!

Change-Id: Id6e8db79fe63031fd1d499f88ea832c5fb4a0363

commit_message:
Deprecate unused ::ceph::rgw::syslog parameter

The syslog parameter is not used by ::ceph::rgw. ceph::rgw::apache_fastcgi
and ::ceph::rgw::apache_proxy_fcgi use the syslog parameter but are
not called from ::ceph::rgw. This paramter will be removed in a future
release

Change-Id: I57326a52138826dea1902dab7fe1cbe97c3ee861

commit_message:
Remove packages in the requirements file so they are reinstalled.

In the gate jobs, tripleo-quickstart extras is removed and
reinstalled on the second quickstart.sh run.
This change allows the packages add the to the requirements
to likewise be reinstalled when the second quickstart.sh
job runs.

This is a test change ... DO NOT MERGE.

Change-Id: Ibf8d2d2245ece19c734f0ed50a9519f6a24778a8

subject: Prepare for using standard python tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-03 19:15:47.000000000', 'files': ['tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I5191afb3e8c0fff9f82cb2d937343a67348c9c34
Needed-By: I5ca756d8aeb4fe90fd4ca7ac381a7f684b5c56fb
(cherry picked from commit b628acec24b256c7121f1fe85e0a2ab25fe335df)
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I5191afb3e8c0fff9f82cb2d937343a67348c9c34
Needed-By: I5ca756d8aeb4fe90fd4ca7ac381a7f684b5c56fb
(cherry picked from commit b628acec24b256c7121f1fe85e0a2ab25fe335df)

commit_message:
Add test of attaching a volume at boot time

In addition to booting from volume, we also support booting from image
and attaching a volume. Test it to make it true.

Run of this test without the previous patch fixing it:

http://logs.openstack.org/68/430468/2/check/gate-shade-dsvm-functional-neutron/51ab62a/console.html

Generalize upgrade paths for osds

commit_message:
Cleanup more Sphinx warnings during doc build

This is a second pass at cleaning up Sphinx issues with the doc build.
These ones only show themselves on a full rebuild after you blow away
doc/build/* so they weren't always seen.

Change-Id: I44e39b7e1f2bcf7a5eb420dee1569eb0b84929a4

commit_message:
Explicitly add users to projects

In the change over from keystone v2 to v3, the user create calls no
longer create any role association between users and projects they are
created with. This makes the grenade user creation more explicit to
work around this.

Change-Id: Ib17b61641cfeb5f10bf7d01f9b02019fb1e9dbf8
Related-Bug: #1662911

revisions:

Fuel-utils could be used for automation of some tasks
and it is crucial service status checks to be adequate.

Partial-Bug: #1656872
(cherry picked from commit 7c1608c2f4340b00779f2a0ea887d1f5294efead)

commit_message:
Nailgun status check should include http responses

Fuel-utils could be used for automation of some tasks
and it is crucial service status checks to be adequate.
It is not enough to check that nailgun is started
we also need to check that it accepts requests and
responds.

Change-Id: I587925a468283cf48e22dc8afef36d7674af9903
Partial-Bug: #1656872
(cherry picked from commit 7c1608c2f4340b00779f2a0ea887d1f5294efead)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-08 04:01:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/216_havana.py'], 'message': "Reduce the number of COMMIT & SELECT 1 statements

Reusing a connection rather than the engine to execute statements
significantly reduces the number of COMMIT and SELECT 1 statements
emitted during migrations.

For example, here's the difference for the following test.

    unit.db.test_migrations.TestNovaMigrationsMySQL.test_walk_versions

    $ grep COMMIT sql.out.before | wc -l
        1122
    $ grep 'SELECT 1' sql.out.before | wc -l
        3518

    $ grep COMMIT sql.out.after | wc -l
         896
    $ grep 'SELECT 1' sql.out.after | wc -l
        3296

Change-Id: Id0d69c88c11510fc3e958086c2ab1e7d6de99571
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce the number of COMMIT & SELECT 1 statements

Reusing a connection rather than the engine to execute statements
significantly reduces the number of COMMIT and SELECT 1 statements
emitted during migrations.

For example, here's the difference for the following test.

    unit.db.test_migrations.TestNovaMigrationsMySQL.test_walk_versions

    $ grep COMMIT sql.out.before | wc -l
        1122
    $ grep 'SELECT 1' sql.out.before | wc -l
        3518

    $ grep COMMIT sql.out.after | wc -l
         896
    $ grep 'SELECT 1' sql.out.after | wc -l
        3296

Change-Id: Id0d69c88c11510fc3e958086c2ab1e7d6de99571

subject: adds ovs-dpdkctl tool
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-20 16:14:39.000000000', 'files': ['tools/ovs-dpdkctl.sh'], 'message': 'adds ovs-dpdkctl tool

- This change introduces a new tool for configuring
  host interfaces for use with ovs and dpdk.
- The ovs-dpdkctl tool will be executed via systemd
  when a system first boots to bind interfaces to
  dpdk compaible drivers.
- The ovs-dpdkctl tool will be injected into the
  ovsdb container to allow external configuration of
  ovs bridges and ports for use with dpdk.

Change-Id: Ie8f32d097f0a6816c2ddd03ade926c00837da322
'}]
commit_message:
adds ovs-dpdkctl tool

- This change introduces a new tool for configuring
  host interfaces for use with ovs and dpdk.
- The ovs-dpdkctl tool will be executed via systemd
  when a system first boots to bind interfaces to
  dpdk compaible drivers.
- The ovs-dpdkctl tool will be injected into the
  ovsdb container to allow external configuration of
  ovs bridges and ports for use with dpdk.

Change-Id: Ie8f32d097f0a6816c2ddd03ade926c00837da322

commit_message:
Use neutron user in neutron_lbaas.conf and overwrite defaults

Lbaas should make a call to Barbican with the neutron-service-user.
Moreover, it is needed to set up the region as well as
endpoint_type in order to overwrite the defaults.

Change-Id: I13105d092cb4397db1bc6481c5ca6677b4d4c048
Closes-Bug: #1659249

commit_message:
Using yaml.safe_load instead of yaml.load

It is not safe to call yaml.load with any data received from
an untrusted source, we'd better use yaml.safe_load

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ic8bf73bf0f2e2c29eb48094367cf558483be1267

commit_message:
Remove openstack-ceilometer-expirer check

This wont work as openstack-ceilometer-expirer
cant be listed from systemctl.

Also we are not runing any upgrade task.

i.e.:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ceilometer]# systemctl list-units | grep ceilometer
  openstack-ceilometer-api.service           loaded active running   OpenStack ceilometer API service
  openstack-ceilometer-central.service       loaded active running   OpenStack ceilometer central agent
  openstack-ceilometer-collector.service     loaded active running   OpenStack ceilometer collection service
  openstack-ceilometer-notification.service  loaded active running   OpenStack ceilometer notification agent

Change-Id: Ia9f7d3744264af1a37c06b9c8878cd95bed4e1c5

commit_message:
Nailgun status check should include http responses

Fuel-utils could be used for automation of some tasks
and it is crucial service status checks to be adequate.
It is not enough to check that nailgun is started
we also need to check that it accepts requests and
responds.

Change-Id: I587925a468283cf48e22dc8afef36d7674af9903
Partial-Bug: #1656872
(cherry picked from commit 7c1608c2f4340b00779f2a0ea887d1f5294efead)

commit_message:
Update the upgrades part of devref

This removes some references to "online schema migrations", as well
as some references to in-progress things that have been (long since)
completed. It also clarifies some of the upgrade steps, and unifies
the notion of "offline" and "live" upgrades, calling out only a couple
places where the process differs.

This came from me explaining the document to someone and calling out
things that were no longer accurate.

Change-Id: Iec1d73c3fd0038d9bca7e7fa746caad06c329ed3
(cherry picked from commit 4f86207285abfba7b87d5b477d99763203a03c53)

subject: DHCP: enhance DHCPAgent startup procedure
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 8157, 'name': 'Bertrand LALLAU', 'email': 'bertrand.lallau@gmail.com', 'username': 'blallau'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20330, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V Networking CI', 'email': 'microsoft_neutron_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_neutron_ci'}, {'_account_id': 23804, 'name': 'Daniel Alvarez', 'email': 'dalvarez@redhat.com', 'username': 'dalvarez'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-23 11:26:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py'], 'message': "DHCP: enhance DHCPAgent startup procedure

During DhcpAgent startup procedure all the following networks
initialization is actually perform twice:
 * Killing old dnsmasq processes
 * set and configure all TAP interfaces
 * building all Dnsmasq config files (lease and host files)
 * launching dnsmasq processes
What is done during the second iteration is just clean and redo
exactly the same another time! This is really inefficient and
increase dramatically DHCP startup time (near twice than needed).

Initialization process 'sync_state' method is called twice:
 * one time during init_host()
 * another time during _report_state()

sync_state() call must stay in init_host() due to bug #1420042.

sync_state() is always called during startup in init_host()
and will be periodically called by periodic_resync()
to do reconciliation.
Hence it can safely be removed from the run() method.

Change-Id: Id6433598d5c833d2e86be605089d42feee57c257
Closes-bug: #1651368
Closes-Bug: #1650611
(cherry picked from commit 21963618ca7accfe0b5d3389ee15426d5032a2ac)
"}]
commit_message:
DHCP: enhance DHCPAgent startup procedure

During DhcpAgent startup procedure all the following networks
initialization is actually perform twice:
 * Killing old dnsmasq processes
 * set and configure all TAP interfaces
 * building all Dnsmasq config files (lease and host files)
 * launching dnsmasq processes
What is done during the second iteration is just clean and redo
exactly the same another time! This is really inefficient and
increase dramatically DHCP startup time (near twice than needed).

Initialization process 'sync_state' method is called twice:
 * one time during init_host()
 * another time during _report_state()

sync_state() call must stay in init_host() due to bug #1420042.

sync_state() is always called during startup in init_host()
and will be periodically called by periodic_resync()
to do reconciliation.
Hence it can safely be removed from the run() method.

Change-Id: Id6433598d5c833d2e86be605089d42feee57c257
Closes-bug: #1651368
Closes-Bug: #1650611
(cherry picked from commit 21963618ca7accfe0b5d3389ee15426d5032a2ac)

commit_message:
Update CI for monasca-log-api

* enable python-jobs
monasca-log-api supports now docs environment in tox
and python-jobs which was the only job-type missing
* move python35 from non-voting to voting stagae
* add gate that would ensure compatybility with recent
oslo changes

Additionally:
* removed running devstack gate for stable/mitaka
and stable/newton as the devstack plugin and gate
was not functional that time

Depends-On: I8377c1a846d29854cff623b1abaa467df50fcc28
Depends-On: I818c66be11bc75358caf8809646ff9a9c35a2c91
Change-Id: Ie289f5ca3d82a3150a0d0f8b8284385efe6ae4b2

subject: Get server fault if snapshot fails
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-07 22:06:31.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/base.py', 'tempest/exceptions.py', 'tempest/tests/api/compute/test_base.py'], 'message': "Get server fault if snapshot fails

When we get a 404 from Glance because a server snapshot
is not found while we're waiting for it to be ACTIVE, it
means Nova deleted the failed snapshot from Glance because
something failed in nova-compute during the snapshot
operation.

Rather than just dump a 404 in the test console output on this
type of failure, this change gets the server which should have
a fault recorded and uses that to raise a more useful error
message for the test output.

Change-Id: I8ee2e18925e7f4f09d10d857fb25f3d9b8e8bd42
"}]
commit_message:
Get server fault if snapshot fails

When we get a 404 from Glance because a server snapshot
is not found while we're waiting for it to be ACTIVE, it
means Nova deleted the failed snapshot from Glance because
something failed in nova-compute during the snapshot
operation.

Rather than just dump a 404 in the test console output on this
type of failure, this change gets the server which should have
a fault recorded and uses that to raise a more useful error
message for the test output.

Change-Id: I8ee2e18925e7f4f09d10d857fb25f3d9b8e8bd42

subnets, ports, subnet pools, and routers.
This patch describes which extensions supports them.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-03 23:07:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/metadata/namespace_proxy.py'], 'message': 'Skip reading config files from neutron.conf.d for the namespace proxy

The namespace proxy should only be handling config options passed in
via commandline. To achieve that it overwrites default config file
detection by explicitely passing in an empty list, however it did
not overwrite default config dir detection.

Starting with oslo.config 3.20.0, a default config_dir setting reads
files from $service.conf.d.

As Newton shipped with oslo.config 3.17, which did not expose this new
feature, this is a fix for Ocata only and does not affect Upgrade.

Change-Id: Id2dffe6f53afbfd48128d91c5d807be8785534eb
Closes-Bug: #1661106
'}]
commit_message:
Skip reading config files from neutron.conf.d for the namespace proxy

The namespace proxy should only be handling config options passed in
via commandline. To achieve that it overwrites default config file
detection by explicitely passing in an empty list, however it did
not overwrite default config dir detection.

Starting with oslo.config 3.20.0, a default config_dir setting reads
files from $service.conf.d.

As Newton shipped with oslo.config 3.17, which did not expose this new
feature, this is a fix for Ocata only and does not affect Upgrade.

Change-Id: Id2dffe6f53afbfd48128d91c5d807be8785534eb
Closes-Bug: #1661106

commit_message:
Fix duplicated sg rules check for remote_ip_prefix

Security group rule setting remote_ip_prefix 0.0.0.0/0 for ipv4 or
::/0 for ipv6 plays the same role as the sg rules without setting
remote_ip_prefix. We could treat them as duplicate.

Change-Id: Ic9213e77d3b03aded7fc34d486066c8af4a3b2a1
Closes-Bug: #1534113

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 05:44:18.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/api/controllers/v1/topology.py', 'vitrage/datasources/nagios/driver.py', 'vitrage/api/controllers/v1/rca.py', 'vitrage/entity_graph/processor/notifier.py', 'vitrage/api/controllers/v1/alarm.py', 'vitrage/api/controllers/v1/template.py', 'vitrage/utils/file.py', 'vitrage/api/app.py', 'vitrage/evaluator/template_validation/template_content_validator.py', 'vitrage/datasources/aodh/driver.py', 'vitrage/opts.py', 'vitrage/api/controllers/v1/resource.py'], 'message': "Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: Ibd90eab7fb52e4f2482b5ffc9bc087804804ad19
"}]
commit_message:
Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: Ibd90eab7fb52e4f2482b5ffc9bc087804804ad19

issue causes the agent to die on first startup when deploying

Closes-Bug: #1649124

commit_message:
Escape quotes in conn_uri declaration to fix agent startup

This causes the manager declaration to fail because the quotes
are expected to be escaped in the Manager declaration and this
issue causes the agent to die on first startup when deploying
with tripleo.  Where are the functional tests running?

Change-Id: Ibf59835a34f2e34212a18e2dc705a84a359b6806
Closes-Bug: #1649124

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I5191afb3e8c0fff9f82cb2d937343a67348c9c34
Needed-By: I5ca756d8aeb4fe90fd4ca7ac381a7f684b5c56fb
(cherry picked from commit b628acec24b256c7121f1fe85e0a2ab25fe335df)

Instances that are in the rescue state, can't be live-migrated.

commit_message:
Live Migration of Rescued Instances

Instances that are in the rescue state, can't be live-migrated.
This can stop an operators upgrading a host, as they first want to empty
the host using live-migrate.

The spec proposes a away to slowly add support for live-migrating
rescued instances to each of the virt drivers.

Previously-approved: Newton
APIImpact

Change-Id: I4602047a712da41a803f49d088437e0c3f220915

commit_message:
Fix for migration tests

Fixture for migration tests should have "function" type.
There is no "rep_call" attribute for test call
in case of preparation failed. Test results order check
changed accordingly.

Change-Id: I7e58a111501ad41701ebfaa703fb12e7a9670fed
Partial-Bug: 1647483
(cherry picked from commit df210476edded6582db521af84b044ef10777710)

subject: Select right image url before download
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-02 21:46:39.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/extensions/test_standby.py', 'ironic_python_agent/extensions/standby.py'], 'message': 'Select right image url before download

The selection of the image is currently done within the ImageDownload
class which responsability is to find the right url and then download
the right image while calculating a MD5 hash.

This commit get the image url selection algorithm outside the
ImageDownload class allowing the caller _stream_raw_image_onto_device
to know the right url. This will allow to know the image size before
downloading it in order to allocate the right amount of space on
the target disk.

Change-Id: I587f9ec75832847b8ad6f87c733e2e9ed7510571
Partial-bug: 1661328
'}]
commit_message:
Select right image url before download

The selection of the image is currently done within the ImageDownload
class which responsability is to find the right url and then download
the right image while calculating a MD5 hash.

This commit get the image url selection algorithm outside the
ImageDownload class allowing the caller _stream_raw_image_onto_device
to know the right url. This will allow to know the image size before
downloading it in order to allocate the right amount of space on
the target disk.

Change-Id: I587f9ec75832847b8ad6f87c733e2e9ed7510571
Partial-bug: 1661328

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22474, 'name': 'OPNFV CI', 'email': 'opnfvci@gmail.com', 'username': 'opnfvci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-08 12:07:54.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/files/boot.ipxe'], 'message': "playbooks: bifrost-ironic-install: Fix reboot if iPXE boot failed

If iPXE boot failed, then make sure the 'reboot' action is really
executed. The problem with 'prompt --timeout...' is that this command
will fail if no key is pressed. However, iPXE exits immediately if
one of the command fails so the 'reboot' action was never executed and
the node was stuck in the following unbootable state.

boot.ipxe : 395 bytes [script]
/pxelinux.cfg/52-54-00-23-e4-c2... No such file or directory (http://ipxe.org/2d0c613b)
/pxelinux.cfg/default... ok
Configuring (net0 52:54:00:23:e4:c2).................. Error 0x040ee119 (http://ipxe.org/040ee119)
Could not boot: Error 0x040ee119 (http://ipxe.org/040ee119)
PXE boot failed. No configuration found for MAC 52:54:00:23:e4:c2
Press any key to reboot...
Could not boot image: Connection timed out (http://ipxe.org/4c22e035)
No more network devices

Change-Id: If4b2bab25bcfe8da0a64ee9cc1659580aec9776a
"}]
commit_message:
playbooks: bifrost-ironic-install: Fix reboot if iPXE boot failed

If iPXE boot failed, then make sure the 'reboot' action is really
executed. The problem with 'prompt --timeout...' is that this command
will fail if no key is pressed. However, iPXE exits immediately if
one of the command fails so the 'reboot' action was never executed and
the node was stuck in the following unbootable state.

boot.ipxe : 395 bytes [script]
/pxelinux.cfg/52-54-00-23-e4-c2... No such file or directory (http://ipxe.org/2d0c613b)
/pxelinux.cfg/default... ok
Configuring (net0 52:54:00:23:e4:c2).................. Error 0x040ee119 (http://ipxe.org/040ee119)
Could not boot: Error 0x040ee119 (http://ipxe.org/040ee119)
PXE boot failed. No configuration found for MAC 52:54:00:23:e4:c2
Press any key to reboot...
Could not boot image: Connection timed out (http://ipxe.org/4c22e035)
No more network devices

Change-Id: If4b2bab25bcfe8da0a64ee9cc1659580aec9776a

commit_message:
Retry to connect to RPC if failed

If Ironic API can't connect to AMQP,
it won't loop to try again later.
According to configured retries parameter
``[api]/rpc_retry_count`` RPC client is
instantiated with appropriate parameter 'retry'
that is used upon transient failures.

Change-Id: I0bdfeafb31973c6b4d58a1f57b4974e50145a946
Closes-Bug: 1564075

commit_message:
Add region fallback lookup

  For ceilometer, glance, cinder, nova, neutron, sahara and swift
  try to fallback region lookup on top hiera('region') key
  when creating keystone endpoints.

Change-Id: I4ac23e7e00718d02d0046ca6ff114ed26923f8d6
(cherry picked from commit 1abf7a2b18ca581093e280ca4a021cd7a2667810)
